name: Turkey and Dumplings Casserole
description: Using leftover turkey you can make a turkey or chicken and dumplings casserole instead of soup.
recipeIngredient: 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup
1 (8 ounce) can refrigerated crescent roll dough, chopped
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 cup bread crumbs, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Spray a casserole dish with cooking spray.

Combine chicken soup, milk, thawed vegetables, turkey, crescent roll dough, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Transfer mixture to the prepared casserole dish. Top with bread crumbs. Spray a layer of cooking spray on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until casserole is heated through, about 30 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving, 5 to 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Could call this "Turkey Pot Pie" with the crust inside. Since it was so simple and quick wasn't expecting this to be yummy. Hubby loved it too. Made as written but added 1/4 teaspoon Italian Seasoning. Was concerned the expired chopped Crescents roll dough wouldn't cook fully so added 5 minutes and they tasted great like tiny biscuits/dumplings. The bread crumbs made a very brown crust. Next time will add 1/4 to 1/2 cup each of the turkey and veggies plus double Italian Seasoning.

I was looking for something to do with leftover Thanksgiving turkey and happened upon this recipe.  I had all the ingredients including a can of crescent rolls which had been languishing in my frig forever.   I made it pretty much as directed except I used Italian Seasoned Panko Bread Crumbs for the topping.  I think this was an important change as the casserole itself had no seasoning without it.  The crescent rolls were cut into approximately 1/2 x 1/2 inch squares but did not fully cook which was somewhat disturbing to be eating raw dough.  I know it was supposed to be dumpling like but it was not.  I wonder if possibly baking them slightly ahead of time would have helped, or maybe cutting them into smaller pieces.  Anyway, I found this to be very good and will try to remember it to make again.
